Posts.Content: michmom14 wrote: I went in for what I thought would be a routine and largely final check in on my lumps (thought to be likely fibrocystic changes) and the nurse had the Breast surgeon come in this time.....who then sent me for an ultrasound again as she couldn't believe it couldn't see a larger lump at all and she didn't like it.  Well ultrasound didnt show them this time either but it did show echogenic (pretty sure that is the right word) areas sort of thoughout those sides of the breasts this time.  So I had 2 core biopsies done on both breasts even though she was leaning towards exisional biopsy anyways (I will likely have one taken out anyways regardless of core biopsy results) The biopsy was really hard she had a lot of trouble getting the needle into both and the right one poured blood quickly.  That is the one she will likely remove anyways as she couldn't reach as deep into as wanted- the center was to hard.  It was so unexpected. Just a follow up with the nurse. I'm still left going wth just happened. Guess I find out Thursday. So what are some benign issues that form hard undetectable masses in your breast? Is that typical for fibrocystic breast issues? I'm really just trying to figure out how much I should be concerned at this point....as I kinda got shock-ey and didn't ask.   Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Unexpected....questions michmom14 michmom14

Posts.Content: Apr 2, 2014 06:02AM michmom14 wrote: thanks guys:) they said they'd call Thursday so I only have two days to wait. I'm glad to hear fibrodenomas can hide out in Fibrocystic breasts to! That's a relief. Thank you for the panic control. Lol
Posts.Title: Unexpected....questions michmom14 michmom14

Posts.Content: Mar 12, 2014 12:12PM michmom14 wrote: somewhat. While lactating there is so much that can go amiss and BC itself tends to get more difficult to diagnose. I am also breastfeeding and have a palpable mass in my right breast. Had diagnostic mamo and ultrasound and they said my breasts were very, very dense and gave me a birads zero.  They couldn't see the mass which means it's likely tissue but they didn't feel like they could see well at all so..... I am going in every two months and then they will do a follow up diagnostic mammo and ultrasound after 6 months or possibly an MRI.  I choose not to have an attempted biopsy done at this time but that was me. Sounds like they are keeping a good eye on you!
Posts.Title: Worried about ibc. Scaredtoronto lekker

Posts.Content: Mar 13, 2014 12:57AM - edited Mar 13, 2014 12:59AM by michmom14 Just to add a different perspective swastika is a popular Hindu name: in India where she lives it is a symbol of peace. "Among the Hindus and particularly among Bengalis, Swastika is a name we often come across. Derived from the Sanskrit word 'svastika', it is considered a sacred symbol in Hinduism, which is considered to be auspicious."  Not that this is necessarily the case here but it could be.
Posts.Title: Is my condition severe? Need help Swastika mjm1

Posts.Content: michmom14 wrote: So I got my biopsy results back (b9) but with some quirks I guess. They found atypical hyperplasia and two nodular lactational hyperplasia or aka lactational adenomas. They've followed me for about 4 months now.....due to very high breast density and fibrosis the adenomas don't show on ultrasound at all, despite being extremely palpable and large.  They said even though the adenomas haven't changed in the last 4 months I am showing a lot of progression in symptoms such as deepening and new dents, dimpling and nipple pull. They want me to wean the baby and to go back in 2 1/2 months again for a likely breast MRI.  Two weeks after my biopsy I developed another third but much smaller lump. and a new indent. Should I call and inform them or just cross it off my mind until then.....and does this sound like a good plan of action? They said the MRI would be less effective while nursing ....and both ultrasound and mammogram are ineffective too.  My biopsies were blind and she said that doesn't help rule bad stuff out as well as if it was ultrasound guided.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Questions on follow up michmom14 mjm1
